text: Cheshunt railway station serves the town of Cheshunt in Hertfordshire, England. It is on the West Anglia Main Line, and train services are provided by Abellio Greater Anglia and London Overground. Former operator National Express East Anglia has fulfilled a franchise commitment to extend the bay platform at Cheshunt to accommodate 8-coach trains (previously it could only accommodate up to 6 coaches). The works also involved replacing all existing station buildings, and replacing the station footbridge. Construction started in December 2005 and was largely complete by August 2006. In the 2012 Summer Olympics, Cheshunt station (along with Waltham Cross, the next southbound station) served as the main access point for the Broxbourne whitewater canoe and kayak slalom. ==Other websites== Category:Railway stations in Hertfordshire Category:Railway stations served by National Express East Anglia Category:1846 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1840s establishments in England
title: Cheshunt railway station
